paragraph 1: 5. Investment income and financing costs
paragraph 2: Investment income comprises interest received from short-term investments and other receivables as well as certain foreign exchange movements. Financing costs mainly arise from interest due on bonds and commercial paper issued, bank loans and the results of hedging transactions used to manage foreign exchange and interest rate movements
paragraph 3: Note: 1 Includes €305 million (2018: €187 million; 2017: €272 million) of interest on foreign exchange derivatives.
